name: Grilled Lamb Cutlets with Broad Bean Puree & Mint Oil
description: Lamb chops grilled and served on a bed of pureed broad beans with a drizzle of mint and parsley oil.

method.heading: Step 1
method.body: Turn your grill to a medium heat. Season the lamb well with half the salt and pepper, and then place on a well-oiled roasting tray. Meanwhile, bring a saucepan of water to a gentle boil.

method.heading: Step 2
method.body: Place the lamb under the grill for 2-3 mins per side for medium-rare, 3 mins or longer per side for well-done. While it cooks, simmer the broad beans for 4-5 minutes until tender.

method.heading: Step 3
method.body: Whilst waiting for the beans and lamb to finish cooking, roughly chop the mint and parsley and mix it with the rest of the olive oil and seasoning.

method.heading: Step 4
method.body: Remove the beans from the heat, drain them, and blend in a food processor. Plate a large spoonful on each plate, then place the lamb on top, two cutlets per person. Drizzle over the mint and parsley oil and serve.

name: Wood Pigeon Breast with Beetroot & Cherry Jus
description: Pan-seared pigeon breast, served with roasted beetroot and a reduction of fresh cherries and red wine vinegar.

method.heading: Step 1
method.body: Preheat your oven to 200 degrees centigrade. Peel and dice the beetroot, toss in olive oil and a pinch of salt, then roast for 30 minutes until soft and caramelised.

method.heading: Step 2
method.body: While the beetroot is roasting, place the cherries, vinegar, rosemary, and a crushed garlic clove in a small saucepan. Simmer gently for 10 to 15 minutes until the sauce thickens slightly.

method.heading: Step 3
method.body: Season the pigeon breasts with salt and pepper. Heat a little olive oil in a pan and sear the breasts for 2 to 3 minutes on each side (longer if you prefer well done). Rest for 5 minutes.

method.heading: Step 4
method.body: To serve, arrange the roasted beetroot on plates, slice the pigeon breast and place on top, then drizzle generously with the cherry jus.

name: Pan-Fried Sea Bream with Samphire & New Potatoes
description: Sea bream fillets seared until crispy, served with boiled new potatoes and buttered samphire.

method.heading: Step 1
method.body: Place the new potatoes in a saucepan, cover with salted water, bring to a boil and simmer for 12 to 15 minutes or until tender.

method.heading: Step 2
method.body: While the potatoes cook, rinse the samphire and set aside. In a frying pan, melt the butter and gently sauté the samphire for 2 to 3 minutes until bright green and just tender.

method.heading: Step 3
method.body: Season the sea bream fillets with salt and pepper. Heat the olive oil in a non-stick pan and cook the fillets skin-side down for 3 to 4 minutes until crisp, then flip and cook for another 1 to 2 minutes.

method.heading: Step 4
method.body: Lastly, divide the potatoes and samphire between plates, placing a fillet of sea bream on top. Mix the remaining pan juices with the lemon, warm through and drizzle over the fish before serving.

name: Langoustine & Pea Risotto
description: Langoustine tail meat gently cooked with a fresh pea purée and spring onions in a creamy risotto base.

method.heading: Step 1
method.body: Finely chop the spring onions and sauté in butter for 2 to 3 minutes. Add the risotto rice and stir for 1 minute until translucent.

method.heading: Step 2
method.body: Add the wine, reducing until only a quarter remains. Gradually add the stock, one ladle at a time, stirring continuously and letting it absorb into the rice before adding more.

method.heading: Step 3
method.body: Meanwhile, boil the peas for 3 to 4 minutes and blend half into a smooth purée. Reserve the rest whole.

method.heading: Step 4
method.body: With 5 minutes remaining in the risotto, stir in the langoustine tails, pea purée, whole peas, and dill. Cook gently until the langoustine is pink and tender.

method.heading: Step 5
method.body: Season with salt and pepper. Let the risotto rest for 2 minutes before serving.

name: Bilberry & Almond Tart
description: A shortcrust pastry tart filled with almond frangipane and fresh bilberries, served warm with cream.

method.heading: Step 1
method.body: Preheat your oven to 180 degrees. Line a tart tin with the shortcrust pastry and chill in the fridge for 10 minutes.

method.heading: Step 2
method.body: Cream together the butter and sugar until light. Beat in the eggs one at a time, then fold in the ground almonds to make the frangipane.

method.heading: Step 3
method.body: Spread the frangipane evenly into the chilled pastry case. Scatter the bilberries over the top, gently pressing them into the filling.

method.heading: Step 4
method.body: Bake for 35 to 40 minutes until the filling is golden and set. Serve warm with a generous drizzle of cream.

name: Strawberry & Basil Ice Cream
description: Homemade ice cream using puréed strawberries and finely chopped basil in a custard base.

method.heading: Step 1
method.body: Gently heat the milk and cream together in a saucepan until steaming, but not boiling.

method.heading: Step 2
method.body: Whisk the egg yolks and sugar in a bowl. Slowly pour in the hot milk mixture, whisking constantly.

method.heading: Step 3
method.body: Return the custard to the pan and stir over low heat until it thickens enough to coat the back of a spoon. Do not boil.

method.heading: Step 4
method.body: Purée the strawberries and finely chop the basil. Stir both into the cooled custard. Chill the mixture completely.

method.heading: Step 5
method.body: Churn in an ice cream maker or freeze, stirring every 30 minutes, until set. Serve scooped into bowls.

name: Venison Casserole with Chestnuts & Celeriac Mustard Mash
description: A rich, slow-cooked venison casserole with sweet chestnuts, served on a creamy celeriac mash lifted with wholegrain mustard.

method.heading: Step 1
method.body: Preheat oven to 160°C. Cut venison into chunks and brown in olive oil. Remove and set aside.

method.heading: Step 2
method.body: In the same pot, sauté chopped onions, carrots, and garlic. Return venison to the pan with red wine, stock, herbs, and chestnuts. Season and bring to a simmer.

method.heading: Step 3
method.body: Cover and cook in the oven for 1.5 to 2 hours until meat is tender and sauce thickened.

method.heading: Step 4
method.body: Meanwhile, boil peeled celeriac and potatoes until soft. Mash with butter, milk, and mustard. Season to taste.

method.heading: Step 5
method.body: Serve the venison hot with a generous spoonful of mash.

name: Beef & Oyster Stew with Salsify
description: A Victorian-style slow-cooked beef stew with oysters for richness, paired with earthy salsify for old-fashioned depth of flavour.

method.heading: Step 1
method.body: Brown beef in batches in olive oil, then remove. Sauté shallots and garlic until soft.

method.heading: Step 2
method.body: Return beef to the pot, add wine, stock, herbs, and a pinch of salt. Simmer and then braise in oven at 160°C for 2 hours.

method.heading: Step 3
method.body: Peel and poach salsify in lightly salted water until tender. Set aside.

method.heading: Step 4
method.body: In final 10 minutes of stew cooking, add oysters and salsify. Simmer gently until warmed through.

method.heading: Step 5
method.body: Check seasoning and serve hot with crusty bread or mashed roots.

name: Tagliatelle with Wild Mushrooms & Truffle
description: Fresh homemade tagliatelle tossed with sautéed wild mushrooms and shavings of truffle for an elegant seasonal pasta dish.

method.heading: Step 1
method.body: Make pasta dough by sifting flour finely and then mixing it with the beaten eggs. Knead until smooth, rest 30 mins, then roll and cut into tagliatelle.

method.heading: Step 2
method.body: Boil pasta in salted water for 2 to 3 minutes until al dente.

method.heading: Step 3
method.body: Meanwhile, sauté coarsely chopped mushrooms and garlic in butter and olive oil until golden.

method.heading: Step 4
method.body: Toss drained pasta with mushrooms, chopped parsley, salt and pepper. Shave thin slices of truffle over the dish, and serve immediately.
